title: Hunter Biden not asking for 'special treatment' in gun case court appearance, lawyer says
description: Hunter Biden, son of President Joe Biden, will plead not guilty during his initial court appearance on three federal felony gun charges, his attorney said.

title: Microsoft projects two new areas of growth for gaming, leaked document says: Mobile and ads
description: Completing the Activision Blizzard deal that includes King, the company behind Candy Crush, would help Microsoft gain in ads and mobile purchases.

title: Here's everything the Fed is expected to do Wednesday
description: The Federal Reserve concludes its two-day policy meeting Wednesday. Here's what to expect.

title: The 40-hour workweek started with autoworkers—now they're trying to make 32 hours the new norm
description: The United Auto Worker's new proposals aren't the first time the industry has called for a shortened workweek without a pay cut.

title: Ford barrels toward new Canadian strike that could affect F-Series pickup production
description: Canadian union Unifor and Ford are approaching an 11:59 p.m. ET Tuesday deadline to reach an agreement for about 5,600 autoworkers before a strike could occur.

title: Pinterest shares rally after executives tell Wall Street that growth is reaccelerating
description: During its first investor day, Pinterest called for a compound annual growth rate in the mid to high teens, higher than analysts expected.

title: U.S. national debt hits $33 trillion for the first time
description: The federal government faces a potential shutdown if Congress is unable to approve funding authorization in coming weeks.

title: Bank stocks show more signs of life after a tumultuous year. Here's what's causing the run and why we’re optimistic on these financial names
description: Club names Morgan Stanley (MS) and Wells Fargo (WFC), in particular, have perked up recently.

title: U.S. national debt hits $33 trillion for the first time
description: The federal government faces a potential shutdown if Congress is unable to approve funding authorization in coming weeks.

title: Meet Airbnb’s official party pooper, who reduced partying by 55% in two years
description: As the person in charge of Airbnb’s worldwide ban on parties, Naba Banerjee has spent more than three years figuring out how to design an anti-party AI system.

title: Instacart shares start trading on Nasdaq at $42, valuing grocery delivery company at about $14 billion
description: Instacart sold shares at the top end of its expected range, and the valuation jumped to about $14 billion in the company's debut

title: Amazon adding 250,000 workers for the holidays and bumping average pay
description: Amazon said Tuesday it's hiring 250,000 employees in the U.S. to help manage the holiday rush.

title: Biden in United Nations address urges leaders to back Ukraine as consistent with charter
description: President Joe Biden forcefully urged members of the United Nations to support Ukraine against invasion by Russia in a speech at the UN General Assembly.

title: After a year of chaos, CNN bets on new CEO Thompson to focus on long-term viability
description: New CNN CEO Mark Thompson begins his job in October, and he'll likely focus on building a subscription digital businesses around CNN and CNN.com.

title: Apple iPhone 15 Pro review: Lighter weight makes a huge difference
description: The two Pro iPhones are major year-over-year upgrades, with improvements to the camera, an improved physical body, and a new button.

title: Recession-hit Germany is facing a flurry of global headwinds, Goldman Sachs says
description: The German economy is at a crossroads of global issues, according to Peter Oppenheimer, strategist and head of macro research EMEA at Goldman Sachs.

title: YouTube halts Russell Brand channel revenues after sexual assault allegations
description: "If a creator's off-platform behaviour harms our users, employees or ecosystem, we take action," YouTube said in a statement.

title: Saudi energy minister says oil supply cuts are not about 'jacking up prices,' as Brent hovers at $95 a barrel
description: Saudi Arabia is the world's largest seaborne oil exporter and relies on hydrocarbon revenues to support so-called giga-projects designed to diversify its economy.

title: India-Canada tensions hit crisis point after assassination allegations: Here's what you need to know
description: Ottawa had expelled a top Indian diplomat amid credible links between Indian government agents and the slaying of a Sikh community leader in British Columbia.

title: Bank of England deputy governor says impairments rising among UK lenders
description: The British banking sector is seeing a rise in impairments amid rising inflation and ensuing interest rate hikes, according to Bank of England Deputy Governor Sam Woods.

title: CNBC Daily Open: An ‘immaculate disinflation’ amid uncertainty?
description: With the U.S. economy running hot, the labor market remaining tight and oil prices surging again, it’s no surprise markets don't know where rates will go.

title: Huawei's chip breakthrough poses new threat to Apple in China — and questions for Washington
description: Huawei's Mate 60 Pro smartphone has a chip that appears to support 5G, despite U.S. sanctions that have sought to cut the Chinese tech giant off from the technology.

title: China's capital city is letting the public take fully driverless robotaxis — and has bigger rollout plans, startup Pony.ai says
description: Plans for robotaxi testing at Daxing airport in Beijing are coming, said Ning Zhang, vice president at autonomous driving startup Pony.ai.

title: UAW will strike at additional U.S. auto plants if 'serious progress' isn't made by noon Friday
description: The timing of the additional plants would come just over a week after the union announced targeted strikes at assembly plants of about 12,700 autoworkers.

title: Olive oil prices surge over 100% to record highs, sparking cooking oil thefts
description: Olive oil prices spiked to fresh records as droughts in major producing continue to crimp supplies — driving desperate people to resort to stealing it.

title: China VCs have a big problem — and it’s not just a drop in U.S. investor appetite
description: In the years since Alibaba's 2014 U.S. IPO, early-stage investing has drawn tens of billions of dollars into China with relatively little to show for it.
